channel.title: PLWC Podcasts
channel.description: PLWC Podcasts are special audio versions of People Living With Cancer's award-winning content on cancer research, treatment, coping, and many other topics.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Special audio versions of PLWC content.
channel.itunes:summary: PLWC Podcasts are special audio versions of People Living With Cancer's award-winning content on cancer research, treatment, coping, and many other topics.
channel.itunes:author: People Living With Cancer
channel.itunes:keywords: cancer, coping, diagnosis, treatment, survivorship, types

item.title: 2008 Genitourinary Cancers Symposium Highlights, with Howard Sandler, MD, MS
item.description: Howard Sandler, MD, MS, discusses the research highlights from the 2008 Genitourinary Cancers Symposium in San Francisco, California.
item.itunes:subtitle: 2008 Genitourinary Cancers Symposium Highlights, with Howard Sandler, MD, MS
item.itunes:summary: Howard Sandler, MD, MS, discusses the research highlights from the 2008 Genitourinary Cancers Symposium in San Francisco, California.
item.itunes:author: People Living With Cancer
item.itunes:keywords: genitourinary, symposium, prostate, bladder, kidney, testicular, cancer

item.title: Tobacco Use
item.description: Tobacco use is associated with an increased risk of at least fifteen different types of cancer, and quitting smoking is the single most important thing a person can do to lower his or her cancer risk.
item.itunes:subtitle: Tobacco Use
item.itunes:summary: Tobacco use is associated with an increased risk of at least fifteen different types of cancer, and quitting smoking is the single most important thing a person can do to lower his or her cancer risk.
item.itunes:author: People Living With Cancer
item.itunes:keywords: tobacco use, quitting smoking, therapy, myths, tips, support resources

item.title: 2008 Gastrointestinal Cancers Symposium Highlights
item.description: Nicholas Petrelli, MD, discusses the research highlights from the 2008 Gastrointestinal Cancers Symposium in Orlando, Florida.

item.itunes:summary: Nicholas Petrelli, MD, discusses the research highlights from the 2008 Gastrointestinal Cancers Symposium in Orlando, Florida.

item.title: A Decision Aid Tool for Lung Cancer, with Christopher Azzoli, MD
item.description: This podcast discusses a decision aid tool developed by ASCO and Cancer Care Ontario to help people who have had surgery for non-small cell lung cancer talk with their doctor about whether to have chemotherapy after surgery.
item.itunes:subtitle: A Decision Aid Tool for Lung Cancer, with Christopher Azzoli, MD
item.itunes:summary: This podcast discusses a decision aid tool developed by ASCO and Cancer Care Ontario to help people who have had surgery for non-small cell lung cancer talk with their doctor about whether to have chemotherapy after surgery.
item.itunes:author: People Living With Cancer
item.itunes:keywords: lung cancer, decision, asco, cancer care ontario, adjuvant chemotherapy

item.title: Protecting Your Skin From the Sun
item.description: Warmer weather often means more time is spent outdoors in the sun. However, it is important to remember a few simple steps to reduce exposure to the sun’s harmful rays, called ultraviolet or UV rays, because UV exposure is the leading cause of skin cancer.
item.itunes:subtitle: Protecting Your Skin From the Sun
item.itunes:summary: Warmer weather often means more time is spent outdoors in the sun. However, it is important to remember a few simple steps to reduce exposure to the sun’s harmful rays, called ultraviolet or UV rays, because UV exposure is the leading cause of skin cancer.
item.itunes:author: People Living With Cancer
item.itunes:keywords: sun, skin cancer, uva, uvb, protection
